current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for the restoration of the economic and ecological health of National Forest System land and rural communities, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Forest Jobs and Management  Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Forest Jobs and Management Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 4. Projects in Forest Management Emphasis Areas.

text.#text: The purposes of this Act are—
to create a predictable wood supply from National Forest System land that can be harvested, processed, and sold as wood products—
to preserve and create jobs;
to generate revenue to be shared with counties; and
to strengthen rural economies;

to reduce the uncertainty and costs to the Forest Service of planning and implementing  timber management, forest restoration, and community wildfire protection projects  on National Forest System land; and
to promote the use of timber harvest as a method to achieve forest management goals on a portion of non-reserved National Forest System land.
In this Act:

term.#tail: means a project that involves the management or sale of national forest material within a Forest Management Emphasis Area.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means National Forest System land  identified as suitable for timber production in a forest management plan in effect on the date of enactment of this Act.

on which removal of vegetation is specifically prohibited by Federal law.

text.#text: The term
